C90B Emergency Checklist Memory Items.
Emergency Engine Shutdown.
Autopilot. Disconnect. Affected engine. Condition Lever. Cut-off. Propeller Lever. Feather. Fuel Firewall Shutoff Valve. Close. Fire extinguisher, if installed. Actuate.
Engine Failure After Liftoff.
Maximum Continuous Power. Set. Air speed. Maintain, takeoff speed or above. Propeller, inoperative engine. Verify feathered or feather. Airspeed, After obstacles cleared. 108 knots.
Engine Failure During Ground Roll.
Power levers. Ground fine. Brakes. Maximum. If insufficient runway remains for stopping. Condition Lever. Cut-off. Fuel Firewall Shutoff Valve. Close. Master switch. Off, Gang bar down. Boost Pumps. Off.
Engine Fire on ground.
Condition Lever. Cut-off. Fuel Firewall Shutoff Valve. Close.
Engine Failure in Flight below V M C A .
Power. Reduce as required to maintain control. Nose. Lower to accelerate above V M C A . Power. As required.
Second Engine Flameout.
Power Lever. Idle. Propeller Lever. Do, not, feather. Condition Lever. Fuel Cutoff. Conduct air-start. Abnormal procedures, tab 1.
Use of oxygen, electrical smoke or fire, environmental system smoke or fumes, or pressurization loss.
Oxygen system control. Confirm on. Crew. Don mask. For smoke and fumes. Mask Selector. Emergency Position.
Cabin door unlocked.
All occupants. Seated with seatbelts.
Emergency Descent.
Power levers. Idle. Propeller Levers. High RPM. Flaps, 184 knots maximum. Approach. Landing gear, 182 maximum. Down. Airspeed. 182 knots maximum.
Emergency Glide.
Landing gear. Up. Flaps. Up. Propellers. Feathered. Airspeed. 125 knots. Glide ratio. 1.8 nautical miles per 1000 feet.
Autopilot Malfunction, elevator trim runaway.
Control Wheel. Hold firmly, be prepared to accept control wheel forces. Autopilot, yaw damp, trim disconnect button. Depress fully. Flight controls, power levers. As required to recover the airplane.
Unscheduled Rudder Boost Activation.
Rudder Boost. Off. Rudder Trim. As required.
High differential pressure.
Cabin altitude controller. Select higher cabin altitude setting. Item. Action. If condition persists. Bleed air valves. Closed. Cabin Pressure, after cabin is depressurized. Dump. Bleed air valve. Open.
Emergency Exit.
Emergency release hatch cover. open. Release button. Push. If release button will not push, pull hooks to override pressure lock and then push the release button. Pull handle and push out hatch.
Spins Recovery.
Control Column. Full forward, Ailerons neutral. Full Rudder. Opposite direction of spin. Power levers. Idle. Rudder. Neutralize when rotation stops. Execute a smooth pullout.
TAWS Warning.
Wings. Level. Power. Max Allowable. Pitch. Increase first to 20 degrees. Adjust to avoid stall. Aim for 101 knots. Gear and Flaps. Retract.
End checklist memory items.
